original: Cedergren, Karl Johan Arvid, fd. läroverksadjunkt, Norrköping, f. 5/11/ 79 i Visby av bärgn :insp., sjökapt. Johan Olof Niklas C. o. Elisabet Sofia Vilhelmina Fohlin. G. m. Vera Ström. Barn: Karin f. 31. — Mog:ex. i Visby 98, fil. kand. i Upps. 05, provår i Sthlm 11, lek- o. idr :ledarkurs i Sthlm 18. Stud:res. t. Engl. 04 o. 27, Norge 10, Tyskl. 11 o. 27, Belg. 27, delv. m. stats-stip. Vik. adj. i Vadstena 05-06, SundsvaM 06-07, Örebro 09-10 o. 11-17, adj. i Eksjö 16, adj. i tyska o. eng. v. Norrköp. h. a. 1. 24 t. pens., rektors skrivbitr. fr. 29, timlär. v. Norrköp. hand :gymn. fr. 29. Skodöverstyr. omb. v. realex. v. Norrköp. komm. mellansk. 27, Solbacka lärov. 35-37, ordf. i Gotl. gille 30-31, ordf. i Gotl:fören. 45, v. ordf. i Norrköp. konstgilde sed. 34, Sv. eldbegäng:fören. lokalavd. sed. 36, lokalstyr. f. lärov. sed. 39, led. av styr. f. Norrköp. stadsbibi. o. mus. sed. 35, av magistr. utsedd juryman i tryckfri-h :mål. Skr.: Sv. helsaker, De ital. småstaternas poststämplar m^ m., litt:-rec. i dagspressen. Sign.: A. Cgn. RVO.
translated: Cedergren, Karl Johan Arvid, former high school teacher, Norrköping, born on November 5th, 1879 in Visby, son of inspector, sea captain Johan Olof Niklas C. and Elisabet Sofia Vilhelmina Fohlin. Married to Vera Ström. Children: Karin born in 1931. Cedergren completed his secondary education in Visby in 1898, obtained a Bachelor's degree from Uppsala University in 1905, completed a teaching internship in Stockholm in 1911, and took courses in leadership and sports in Stockholm in 1918. He traveled to England in 1904 and 1927, Norway in 1910, Germany in 1911 and 1927, and Belgium in 1927 with state scholarships. He was a substitute teacher in Vadstena from 1905-1906, in Sundsvall from 1906-1907, in Örebro from 1909-1910 and 1911-1917, and a teacher in Eksjö in 1916. He taught German and English at Norrköping high school from 1924 until his retirement in 1949, and worked as a secretary to the school principal from 1929, and as a part-time teacher at Norrköping handcraft school from 1929. He was appointed shoe superintendent and deputy examiner at Norrköping municipal middle school in 1927, and at Solbacka college from 1935-1937. He served as chairman of Gotland Society from 1930-1931, chairman of the Gotland Association in 1945, vice chairman of Norrköping Art Guild since 1934, local branch of the Swedish Cremation Society since 1936, local board member for school since 1939, and member of the board for Norrköping City Library and Museum since 1935. He was appointed by the magistrate as a juror in freedom of speech cases. He authored books on Swedish coats of arms, Italian small state postal stamps, and literary criticism in the daily press. Abbreviated signature: A.Cgn. RVO.

memberOf.name: Board for Norrköping City Library and Museum
